author: Special Correspondent
text:
A large number of bubbletop cans, with a capacity to hold 20 litres of water each, was seized at a packaged drinking water unit in Thalambur near Navalur on Tuesday for misuse of the ISI mark given by Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS).

A press release said that a team of officials from BIS, Southern Regional Office, conducted an enforcement search at Vallabh Aqua, Navalur and found that 20-litres containers with the brand name, ‘New Aqua’ had ISI mark with an expired license number of the company. Action is being initiated by Chennai Branch Office against the offender under section 33 of Bureau of Indian Standards Act 1986 for misusing ISI mark. Residents could register their complaints on misuse of ISI mark on any product to BIS by phone (044-22541076) or mail tosro@bis.org.in.
title: Raid at packaged drinking water unit
